item.name: Customer Order Endpoints
item.description: Endpoints for customers to manage their orders

request.description:
Create order with multiple variants per product. This example shows:

- Product 10 with 3 variants: size (Large +$5), color (Blue), material (Cotton +$10)
- Product 15 with 1 variant: size (Medium)

**selected_variants array structure:**
- `id`: ProductVariant ID
- `name`: Variant type (size, color, material, etc.)
- `value`: Specific variant value
- `additional_price`: Price modifier for this variant

**Notes:** All variants in the array must belong to the same product. The total price will include base product price + sum of all additional_price values.

item.name: Create Order - Legacy Single Variant Example

request.description:
Create order using legacy single variant format. This maintains backward compatibility.

**Legacy Format:**
- Uses `variantId` instead of `selected_variants` array
- Supports only one variant per product
- Suitable for existing integrations

**Example Items:**
- Product 5 (qty: 3) with variant 12
- Product 8 (qty: 1) with variant 18

**Note:** Cannot mix legacy `variantId` and new `selected_variants` formats in the same order item.
